description: Cité de Dieu; Master of the Oxford Hours (French, active about 1440s), and assistant to Master of the Oxford Hours (French, active about 1440s), and Master of the Geneva Boccaccio (French, active about 1445 - 1470), et al; Nantes (probably), France; 1440 to 1450; Tempera colors, gold and silver paint on parchment bound between pasteboard covered with worn red velvet; Leaf: 36.2 × 27.3 cm (14 1/4 × 10 3/4 in.); Ms. Ludwig XI 10; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
